result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangelo R. Encarnacion

2:59 PM
Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm. atty status. Bond continued as previously set. DE states he filed Advocate 10/1/22. ec
Adjourned initial appearance on November 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:14 PM    Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes: Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm..   Cash bond posted and continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). DE waives time for the preliminary hearing. DE given Advocate Counsel paperwork again today. rb
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Deangelo R. Encarnacion, appeared.   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE is not eligible for SPD and is given advocate counsel paperwork today.   DE waives time for the preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
